revised_title: Structural Analysis of Guinea Pig Sphincter Pupillae Muscle Cells
tldr: The study examines the unique structure and innervation of the sphincter pupillae muscle cells in guinea pigs. The smooth muscle cells have a high surface-to-volume ratio, irregular shapes, and a high density of innervation. The research provides insights into the peculiar characteristics of this muscle and its potential implications for understanding smooth muscle structures in general.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
